content:
The cheapest car is a 2020 Escape with the Active trim, and it has an MSRP of $29,633.
_Model rationale_: To find the cheapest car, we need to select the vehicle with the lowest MSRP (Manufacturer's Suggested Retail Price). We order the vehicles by the 'msrp' column in ascending order and limit the result to 1 to get the car with the lowest price.
SQL: ```sql
SELECT vin, model, model_year, trim, msrp FROM vehicles ORDER BY msrp ASC LIMIT 1;
```
Key rows:
1. vin=ENX85YWK0X4LAXSR4, model=Escape, model_year=2020, trim=Active, msrp=29633.0
are your guys making electric cars.

I couldn't find this in the indexed Ford documents.

Sources:
[1] https://www.ford.com/vehicles/ (chunk=efb88fae-8093-40c5-a2ac-17505f48668c)
[2] https://www.ford.com/vehicles/ (chunk=528a9039-971b-4c1a-86f0-d8ac6ae8b7fc)
[3] https://www.ford.com/vehicles/ (chunk=6a3c9cec-3ceb-4dce-b01a-d65e41d7593d)
[4] https://corporate.ford.com/operations.html (chunk=f05f04be-7b7d-482c-be73-424939f02107)
